Posts.Content: Fighting my corner - decided action was needed so telephoned and spoke to a nurse on his advice phoned breast clinic passed on to specialists secretary who informed me that a second letter had not been received from my GP - secretary was brilliant - she phoned my GPs surgery to chase it up - turns out the letter was only typed this morning and would be posted this evening! Over a week after my appointment expressing concern! obviously my GP not as worried as me. - Secretary from breast clinic phoned me back within 15 mins so speedy service there - she has promised to look out for letter and make sure its seen by appropriate people and will inform me if they are able to move appointment forward.
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Fighting my corner - decided action was needed so telephoned and spoke to a nurse on his advice phoned breast clinic passed on to specialists secretary who informed me that a second letter had not been received from my GP - secretary was brilliant - she phoned my GPs surgery to chase it up - turns out the letter was only typed this morning and would be posted this evening! Over a week after my appointment expressing concern! obviously my GP not as worried as me. - Secretary from breast clinic phoned me back within 15 mins so speedy service there - she has promised to look out for letter and make sure its seen by appropriate people and will inform me if they are able to move appointment forward.
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Can not believe it - got a telephone call at twenty past eight this evening to be told there is an extra clinic been ran next Thursday and would I like to move my appointment from 13th of May to 16th April - don't know if this is just coincidence which proberbly is or maybe has something to do with phone calls - either way This time next week I will know what I'm dealing with - mixed emotions still got the what ifs but so relived I don't have so long to wait yet at the same time terrified.
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Thanks Jools and Royston for your replies - I know I may be worrying over nothing - just hope that's all it is - its the what ifs that play on my mind I just want someone to say ok your fine go away - but I want them to say it soon - take care x
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies - it s good to know that there are others out there who understand what Im going through. over the last few days my swelling and pain have both disappeared(lasted over 3 weeks) taking this as a good sign. I feel if it was IBC then pain would be persistent - any comments or views would be appreciated Every morning I wake up my first thought is my boob - getting obsessed LOL if GP had not found a lump would now be cancelling appointment - just back playing waiting game Thanks again and take care x
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Got my appointment at Breast clinic this afternoon - although I have tried to convince myself they wont find anything I'm terrified - taking hubby with me - he is the only one that knows about it and he has been brilliant but strain is starting to show - its a one stop breast clinic and is able to give results same day - so today's the day no more waiting - take care x
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Thank you all so much for your support - I GOT THE ALL CLEAR - can not believe my luck - relived doesn't even begin to describe how I feel. Mammogram, ultra sound scan and examination all clear - the doctor I saw said the only explanation was it was down to hormones -( sorry I didn't get straight back on to let you know but had a very upset tum - nerves or a bug don't know which but its clearing now.) I couldn't believe how quick it all was - appointment 2.20 leaving hospital with results at 3.30 - it does however make me wonder how we are treated as women - if it was possible for me to have three different examinations and get results in an hour why are they making lots of women wait sometimes weeks for results? Anyway thanks again for all your support and good luck to you all where ever you are on your journey take care love Linda x
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Hello everyone - I went to docs with painful breast and after examination doc said could feel lump - referred to breast clinic - got appointment through not until 13th MAY - seems like a life time away - not sleeping, constantly worried over the what ifs - went back to docs as breast had swollen but as is sods law it went down and was almost back to normal by the time I saw her - sure doc thinks I'm paranoid- examined again and doc said nothing had changed (I read into this lump still there and same size) - I'm worried that pain and swelling could point to inflammatory breast cancer but when mentioned GP said she not heard of anything using those terms - feel Iv been fobbed off - I didn't argue my case just sat there like an idiot only got angry later and took it out on my poor husband. Doc did however say that she would write and try to get appointment brought forward BUT could not promise anything. So I'm left playing the waiting game (hubby is only one who knows there might be a problem and strain is starting to show - don't know how much longer I can hold out saying yes I'm ok when people ask - but until I know what we are dealing with I'm trying not to worry anyone if that makes sense) What is the two week rule and how does it work - is there anyway I can be seen earlier - sorry for prattling on but so confused
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: my first appointment with doc was 16th March so when I eventually get my appointment will be over 9 wks !
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up
